instructions: Heat a pan over medium heat and spray with nonstick cooking spray.,Add turkey to the pan. I like to smash the turkey down into the pan, season with salt and pepper and let it brown on each side prior to breaking into pieces. Season with salt and pepper and brown.,Once turkey is cooked through add broccoli, carrots, 1/4 cup of water and steam the veggies until slightly soft, stirring frequently. Once the carrots begin to soften add corn, peas, water chestnuts, crushed red pepper to taste and fresh cracked pepper.,Add stir-fry sauce and chili garlic sauce. Mix together well and serve over rice.,For a low carb option serve over zoodles, Healthy Noodles or riced cauliflower.
title: Turkey Stir-Fry

description: Another protein packed meal! By adding zoodles and cabbage to these , noodles you get VOLUME, lots of nutritious volume.
ingredients: [{'amount': '1.5', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': 'chicken breast, chopped into bite size cubes', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'Medium\xa0zucchinis, zoodled', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': None, 'notes': None}, {'amount': '125', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '\xa0sliced cabbage', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'medium yellow bell pepper, sliced', 'notes': '140g'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': 'minced garlic', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '75', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chopped water chestnuts, 1/2 container', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and pepper', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '94', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(one bundle) Lo Mein egg noodles, cooked (Wel Pac)', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '8', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': '\xa0Kikkoman Stir-fry Sauce', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'chopped green onion', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Cut zucchini into zoodles, lay out on a paper towel, sprinkle with salt and let them sweat while you cook.,In a wok or large pan, heat 1/2 tbsp. toasted sesame oil over medium heat. Once hot add chopped chicken, season with salt and pepper and cook until the chicken is cooked through, stirring occasionally to keep from burning. Add garlic, remining sesame oil, bell peppers and cook stirring occasionally until bell peppers begin to soften.,While the chicken is cooking, cook noodles in a separate pan according to package and drain.,Pat zoodles dry and add to pan along with cabbage, water chestnuts and 6 tbsp. of stir-fry sauce. Mix together well and separate the zoodles throughout the dish. Top with toasted sesame seeds and sriracha if desired or serve as is.,Tip: break noodles in half prior to cooking. This will make it easier to serve yourself a true serving vs. all noodles.
title: Chicken Lo Mein

description: You won’t be able to stop eating these ,! Sweet and spicy, amazing macros and under 30 minutes!
ingredients: [{'amount': '5', 'unit': 'oz.', 'name': '\xa0deveined and shelled shrimp (raw)', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'cumin', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'chili powder ', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'onion powder ', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp. ', 'name': 'garlic powder ', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'salt ', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sliced green bell pepper \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'sliced red onion \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '20', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'plain nonfat Greek yogurt \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'lime\xa0wedge \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'basmati rice \u2063', 'notes': 'cooked'}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Jalapeno hot sauce \u2063or any green hot sauce', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': "Joseph's Bakery Lavash", 'notes': None}]
instructions: Peel and devein shrimp. Add seasonings and coat well.,Sauté onions and peppers on greased pan over medium heat until tender and browned. Push to one side and add shrimp.,Cook shrimp ~ 3 mins each side until cooked through. ⁣While the shrimp cooks mix Greek yogurt and lime juice and set aside. ⁣,Once the shrimp has cooked, assemble your burritos. Rice. Shrimp. Veggies. Sauce. Hot sauce.,⁣Roll in a wrap or tortilla, spray the outside of the wrap or tortillas with cooking spray and sear in a warm pan until golden brown.
title: Fajita Shrimp Burritos

description: These , combine , and ,with a delicious and quick gravy for a … I said it … even better than KFC bowl!These bowls can be served upon cooking or reheated throughout the week as meal prep.You’ll be left with lots of gravy too so you can plan to grab some extra potatoes and whip up some Greek Mashed Potatoes for a side dish.
ingredients: [{'amount': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': None, 'notes': None}, {'amount': '185', 'unit': 'g', 'name': None, 'notes': None}, {'amount': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'canned corn', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'gravy', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': 'butter', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'flour', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken broth', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'beef broth', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'pinch of salt', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'pinch on garlic powder', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Assemble your bowl – mashes potatoes, chicken, corn and top with gravy.,Serve immediately or prep for meal prep. Reheats very well.,Melt the butter in a pan over medium heat. Add the flour and stir until combined and lumpy.,Very slowly add small amounts of beef broth while whisking the flour mixture. This will help break up the clumps along the way. Once you have used all the beef broth begin adding the chicken broth.,Season with salt and garlic powder and whisk until the gravy has thickened and lump free.,NOTE! If you end up with lumps (gravy can be tricky) you can toss this in the blender or use a immersion blender for a few pulses and it'll be lump free.
title: Copycat KFC Bowls

description: is spicy, delicious and so easy! Made with homemade cajun seasoning and ready in the air fryer in under 10 minutes, you'll have a great prepped protein for all your meal prep needs.
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': '\xa0chicken breast', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': 'smoked paprika', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': 'garlic powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': '\xa0salt', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'black pepper', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/4 to 1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'cayenne pepper', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Mix seasonings in a deep mixing bowl and set aside.,Slice chicken breast into strips. Add chicken to bowl of seasonings and mix together well to evenly coat.,Preheat air fryer. Lay chicken in air fryer without any pieces overlapping. Cook at 380 for 8 minutes.,You can also pan sear, bake or BBQ this chicken. If baking – either cut into strips or leave in whole breasts and bake at 375 for approx. 20-25 minutes until cooked through and no longer pink. If BBQing – pound chicken breasts to approximately 1/2 inch thick. Top with the seasonings and coat well on all sides. BBQ on both sides until cooked through, approximately 4-5 minutes each side. If pan searing – suggest cutting into strips and searing a hot cast iron until cooked through.
title: Air Fryer Blackened Chicken

description: These , are easy, flavorful and 1 pan makes 4 days worth of food. Prep everything on Sunday and you’re ready to go for most of your week ahead.
ingredients: [{'amount': '1.5', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': 'chicken breast, sliced into strips', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'red bell pepper, sliced', 'notes': '140g'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'orange bell pepper, sliced', 'notes': '140g'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'red onion, sliced', 'notes': '290g'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': '\xa0lime juice', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': 'honey', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': 'chili powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': 'cumin', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'paprika', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'garlic powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'salt', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'pepper', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '360', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'cooked basmati rice', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': 'chopped cilantro', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Juice of 1 lime', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Pinch of salt', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Preheat over to 425.,For meal prepping and measuring purposes I split the chicken and veggies into 2 separate bowls. Mix all dry seasonings in a small bowl. Split in half. Add 1/2 the seasoning to the chicken and half to the peppers and onions. Add 1/2 tbsp of lime and 1/2 tbsp honey to each bowl. Mix to coat everything well.,Spray a baking sheet with cooking spray and spread out chicken and veggies to bake. Bake at 425 for 20-25 minutes until cooked through.,Combine rice, cilantro, lime and salt.,4 oz. cooked chicken 100g veggies 90g cilantro lime basmati rice 424 Cals: 46.4 C / 7.2 F / 45.4 P
title: Sheet Pan Fajita Bowls

description: This ,is pasta perfection! This easy recipe has a homemade lower fat creamy alfredo sauce, juicy blackened chicken breasts, and perfectly cooked pasta to make busy weeknights a little easier and a lot more delicious.
full_name: The BEST Lightened-Up Blackened Chicken Alfredo
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': 'chicken breast, raw', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '8', 'unit': 'oz.', 'name': 'fettuccine noodles – using De Cecco (UNCOOKED)', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': 'Butter', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': 'minced garlic', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'laughing cow cheese wedges (light)', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1 1/3', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': ' Whole Milk', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'oz.', 'name': 'cream cheese, cubed (room temp works best)', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'grated parmesan cheese', 'notes': '56g'}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Fresh cracked black pepper ', 'notes': 'to taste '}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': '\xa0smoked paprika', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': 'garlic powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'salt', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'black pepper', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/4 to 1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'cayenne pepper', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Mix blackening seasonings in a deep mixing bowl and set aside.,Slice chicken breast into strips. Add chicken to bowl of seasonings and mix together well to evenly coat.,– spray a large skillet with nonstick cooking spray and add the chicken to the pan. Cook for 4-5 minutes until cooked through and no longer pink. ,– either cut into strips or leave in whole breasts and bake at 375 for approx. 20-25 minutes until cooked through and no longer pink. ,– pound the chicken fillets to approximately 1/2 inch thick. Top with the seasonings and coat well on all sides. BBQ on both sides until cooked through, approximately 4-5 minutes each side. , – preheat the air fryer to 380 degrees Fahrenheit. Once preheated, lay the chicken in the air fryer basket without any pieces overlapping. Cook at 380 for 8 minutes.,Cook the pasta according to the package directions. ,While the pasta cooks, heat a pan over medium, add butter and melt. Once melted add garlic and laughing cow cheese. Lower heat to medium low. Using the back of a spoon mash the laughing cow cheese until it starts to melt.,Add milk and cream cheese. Mash cream cheese cubes the same way you did the laughing cow until it has melted into the mixture.,Add parmesan and pepper and stir together. Simmer until the mixture thickens into a nice sauce. This does not take long. Once sauce has formed add noodles and chicken and mix until coated well.,Tip – cut your noodles in half for easier serving when weighing.
title: Blackened Chicken Alfredo

description: Busy weeknights get a whole lot better with this ,. This comfort food classic has tender chicken, fresh veggies, and a buttery cream sauce making this easy dinner recipe one you won't want to miss.
ingredients: [{'amount': '1.5', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': 'raw chicken breast, chopped into bite size pieces', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'yellow onion, chopped ', 'notes': '160g'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': '\xa0red bell pepper, cut into strips ', 'notes': '200g'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'green bell pepper, cut into slices', 'notes': '130g'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'package of frozen spinach, defrosted (10 oz. package) and water drained', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'sliced cremini mushrooms', 'notes': '160g'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'can', 'name': '98% fat free condensed cream of mushroom soup', 'notes': '10.5oz can'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'non fat sour cream ', 'notes': '250g'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': 'unsalted butter', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'minced garlic', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'paprika', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and pepper', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Pre heat the oven to 375. Slice and chop your veggies. Add the frozen spinach to a bowl of hot water (keep in the packaging) to let thaw while you cook your veggies.,Heat a large pan over medium heat and add butter to melt. Once the butter has melted add garlic, peppers, onions and mushrooms to the pan and cook. Allow to cook until the onions are translucent and peppers begin to soften. Approx. 5-10 minutes. Add thawed and drained spinach. To drain the water from the spinach just simply squeeze it out of the bag. Be careful though the bag can pop and a disaster follows. Mix the spinach in with the vegetables.,While the vegetables cook, cut your chicken into bite sized pieces. Alternatively, for tracking purposes, you can cut your chicken into 4 oz. cutlets and place on top at the end to cook vs. mixed in with the vegetables.,When the vegetables are done, add cream of mushroom soup, sour cream, paprika, salt and pepper. I have left salt and pepper to your discretion, you can always add to the meal if needed.,Once the mixture is well mixed, add your raw chicken and mix well to combine.,Spray and baking dish with non stick spray and add the mixture to the dish. Bake at 375 for 20 minutes.,If you place the chicken on top vs. mixed it be sure to cook until the chicken is fully cooked.,Serve alone, over noodles, zoodles, rice or cauliflower rice.,Enjoy and let me know how you like it!
title: Creamy Chicken and Veggie Casserole

description: Lasagna for ONE?? That’s not something you hear everyday. Using a loaf pan you can make this , for yourself and enjoy the entire thing for under 400 calories and pretty great macros.
ingredients: [{'amount': '127', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '\xa0sliced zucchini \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '\xa0pasta sauce \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '28', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'reduced fat mozzarella', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '57', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'non fat Greek yogurt \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '62', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'part skim ricotta \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '56', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '\xa0Jennie-o lean Turkey browned', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'salt', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'pepper', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'garlic powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'oregano ', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Using a mandolin slice 1 small zucchini into noodles. Sprinkle with salt and let sit on paper towels to sweat out some of the moisture while you prep the rest.,Dry off zucchini prior to using.,Mix greek yogurt, ricotta, salt, pepper, garlic powder and oregano together and set aside.,Add a spoonful of sauce to the bottom of a loaf pan. Layer half the zucchini, meat, pasta sauce, half ricotta mixture, some mozzarella and repeat. Save a couple pieces of zucchini and mozzarella for the top or add a sprinkle of Parmesan on top. Top with fresh cracked pepper. ⁣,⁣Cover with foil and bake at 375 for 25 mins. Remove foil and bake 5 mins. Broil for 2 mins until browned on top. ⁣
title: Zucchini Lasagna – for ONE

description: I love a recipe that can be used in multiple ways. The Chicken Adobo and Chili Lime Crema is used here on top of lavash chips making the most delicious nachos … ever.
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': "piece\xa0of Joseph's Lavash bread", 'notes': None}, {'amount': '151', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'Chicken Adobo', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'serving Chili Lime Crema', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': '\xa0Spicy Nacho Dip (using the Honest Stand)', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '10', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chopped red onion', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '15', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'light sour cream\u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'lime juice', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'lime zest \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': '\xa0chili powder \u2063', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Cut lavash into chip size pieces.,Lay on a baking dish, spray with cooking spray and top with salt.,Bake at 350 for 5-7 mins until golden brown. Check often to be sure not to burn the chips.,Assemble your nachos. Cheese, meat, toppings. Enjoy!
title: Chicken Adobo Nachos

description: Almost done with that jar of dill pickles? Don’t toss it!! This is the ultimate copycat Chick-Fil-A Grilled Chicken Sandwich.
ingredients: [{'amount': '4', 'unit': 'oz', 'name': 'thin cut chicken breasts', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'jar of pickle juice', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and pepper', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'grean leaf lettuce', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'ripe tomato slice', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'bun (I use Alfaro Artesano bakery buns)', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp\xa0', 'name': 'Bolthouse Farms Honey BBQ Ranch *', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Marinate thin cut chicken breasts in pickle juice for up to 24 hours. Season with salt and pepper and grill for 3 mins each side.,Assemble your sandwich. Buns, sauce on the bottom, top with green leaf lettuce, tomato slice, grilled chicken, some sauce on top and enjoy! ⁣
title: Copycat Chick-Fil-A Grilled Chicken Sandwich

description: Quick and easy weeknight, with a deliciously creamy Dijon sauce in under 30 minutes.
ingredients: [{'amount': '4', 'unit': 'oz', 'name': '\xa0thinly sliced chicken breasts', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'slice deli ham', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'slice reduced fat swiss cheese', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt and pepper', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chicken broth – for simmering', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '40', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '\xa0dijon', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': '\xa0horseradish', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '30', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken broth', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '24', 'unit': 'G', 'name': '2% milk', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Season chicken with salt and pepper. Spray a pan with cooking spray over medium heat and sear chicken on both sides.,Add 4 tbsp. chicken broth and simmer until cooked through. Approx. 5 minutes (will vary depending on the thickness of your chicken).,Mix Dijon, milk, horseradish and chicken broth together in a bowl. Add Dijon cream sauce to the pan with the chicken and simmer for a few minutes. Cover chicken with cream sauce, top with 1 slice of ham and 1 slice of swiss cheese. Cover and cook until the cheese is melted.,Serve with additional creamy Dijon sauce on top.
title: Lazy Chicken Cordon Bleu

description: Taco Tuesday is a thing at our house. My 3 year old comes home from school saying, “it’s Taco Tuesday hooray!” While I can eat tacos pretty much every day I do try to switch it up when I can. This , is the perfect combination of taco seasonings while getting your pasta fix and makes for a super quick and easy meal. Each shell is packed with flavors and texture.
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': '96/4 ground beef', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Taco Seasoning*', 'notes': 'see below'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'can', 'name': 'diced green chilies', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'can', 'name': 'corn, rinsed and drained', 'notes': '160g'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'can', 'name': 'black beans, rinsed and drained', 'notes': '150g'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Red Enchilada Sauce (Old El Paso Enchilada Sauce Mild red)', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '12', 'unit': 'oz.', 'name': 'Barilla Medium Shells', 'notes': 'measured uncooked'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '\xa0reduced sodium beef broth', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '100', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'reduced fat Mexican Cheese', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'salt', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'onion powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'garlic powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'paprika', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': '\xa0chili powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '5', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': 'cumin*', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Fresh cracked pepper', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Approx. 8-10 tbsp water', 'notes': None}]
instructions: In a pan over medium heat, brown ground beef.,Mix taco seasonings together in a small bowl. Add water until it forms a nice smooth paste. Add seasoning to meat and mix. Turn heat down to simmer.,While simmering add corn, beans, green chilies, enchilada sauce, beef broth (is using uncooked pasta only) and mix together well. Simmer for a few minutes. If using cooked pasta (see next step) do not add the beef broth.,Option 1: you can cook your pasta separately at this time according to the package and keep your meat mixture simmering while the pasta cooks. Once cooked add to meat mixture and continue with steps. This will allow you more control over your pasta done-ness vs. directly in the pan with the mixture. Add beef broth as needed to loosen the mixture.,Option 2: increase heat to a low simmering boil and add dry pasta to the meat mixture, mix well and cover. Simmer for 10-15 minutes until the pasta reaches desired done-ness. Stir often so the bottom doesn't burn. If pasta comes out slightly al-dente it will soften as it sits in the warm pan while you finish the final steps.,Once pasta is added to the meat mixture and cooked (via Option 1 or 2) add cheese and mix together well. Grab a plate and spoon out 260g per serving!
title: Taco Tuesday Skillet

description: This , is a winter staple in our house. It’s easily made in the instant pot with ground turkey and beef and a delicious combination of flavors. This macro friendly recipe is meaty, flavorful and the serving size is hefty. Top with sour cream, chopped red onion, shredded cheese and/or avocado and pair with your favorite corn bread.
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': 'lean ground beef ', 'notes': '93/7'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': '\xa0lean ground turkey ', 'notes': '99/1'}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'medium yellow onion, chopped', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'garlic clove, minced', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'bell peppers, chopped (1 green, 1 red)', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': '\xa0cans diced Fire Roasted Tomatoes ', 'notes': '14 oz cans'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'can tomato paste', 'notes': '6 oz.'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'can diced green chilies', 'notes': '4.5 oz'}, {'amount': '1.5', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'low sodium beef broth', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': "can BUSH'S BEST Mixed Beans in a Mild Chili Sauce", 'notes': '15.5oz can '}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': '\xa0chili powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': 'ground cumin', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'salt', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'pepper', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Turn instant pot to sauté, drizzle the bottom with olive oil just to avoid the meat sticking. Add garlic and cook until fragrant.,Add the ground turkey and ground beef to the pot and cook until browned but not fully cooked through.,While still in the sauté function add onions, bell peppers and all remaining ingredients. Stir together well.,Put on the lid and set to pressure cook for 30 minutes. You can let this self release all the way or quick release.,Top with sour cream, Greek yogurt, shredded cheese, chopped red onion and/or avocado. A favorite topping fore this macro friendly chili is the Sweet Heat Jalapenos from Mt. Olive, they add the perfect amount of sweet spice to the dish! Enjoy.
title: Macro Friendly Chili

description: I LOVE ,. This recipe is created for one but can be doubled, tripled, etc. for the entire family to enjoy. Be sure to add some crushed red pepper at the end for some spice!

instructions: Cut raw chicken into strips and cook in a pan over medium heat seasoned with salt and pepper until cooked through.,Cook 2 oz linguini according to package.,Prepare peanut sauce by mixing all ingredients together in a bowl. When 1 minute left on the noodles add the veggies to the boiling pot.,Drain noodles and veggies. Place in a bowl, top with chicken and peanut sauce and mix.,Top with green onions, red pepper flakes and toasted sesame seeds.
title: Peanut Chicken Noodles

description: uses my favorite cut of meat. It’s higher in fat and so delicious. ⁣Great on soft tacos with sautéed peppers and onions, on a bed of spring mix with lots of delicious veggies, chopped on top of nachos or in a sandwich.
ingredients: [{'amount': '2', 'unit': 'lbs', 'name': 'flank steak cut into slices against the grain \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Taco Seasoning', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Slice your meat and place in a air tight container. ⁣ Top with taco seasoning and cover. Shake to coat the meat with the seasonings well.,Marinate for 4-6 hours or overnight. ⁣,Warm a pan over medium. Add cooking spray and sear on each side until desired done-ness. 2-3 mins each side medium. ⁣,Put in soft tacos, salad or chop over nachos. ⁣ Flank steak is definitely my favorite cut of meat. It’s higher in fat and so delicious. ⁣
title: Taco Tuesday Flank Steak

description: Chicken Fried Rice in under 30 minutes. Delicious and filling! Need I say more?
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': 'chicken breast – chopped', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': '\xa0basmati (measured raw), cooked', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen peas – thawed', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'frozen carrots – thawed', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'medium\xa0yellow onion', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': 'minced garlic', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': None, 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': None, 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'ground ginger', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': None, 'name': 'eggs', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Red Pepper Flakes', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Salt and pepper – to taste', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Toppings: chopped green onion, toasted sesame seeds and sriracha', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Chop chicken into bite size pieces and season with salt and pepper. Spray pan with cooking pray and add chopped chicken to pan over medium heat. Cook until almost cooked through.,Add onions and garlic and saute until fragrant. Add thawed vegetables, 1 Tbsp. coconut aminos, 1 Tbsp. sesame oil, mix together and cook for a few minutes.,Add cooked rice, remaining 3 Tbsp. coconut aminos, 1/2 tsp ground ginger, crushed red pepper flakes (to your liking) and mix together well.,Create a hole in the center of the mixture and spray with cooking spray. Add 2 eggs and scramble. Once cooked mix in with the rice mixture.,Top with your favorite additions like sriracha, green onions and sesame seeds and enjoy!!
title: Chicken Fried Rice

description: Meal prep is the key to success when tracking macros. It doesn’t have to be complicated either. These , are flavorful, easy to prep and reheat well. They also have awesome macros.

description: This , recipe is filled with hearty beef, baby potatoes, fresh veggies and nutritious lentils, slow cooked for hours to make a healthy, hearty and easy stew that will last all week long. With 38g of protein, this comfort food classic is perfect for meal prep, large families and cold winter nights.
full_name: Slow Cooker High Protein Beef, Potato and Lentil Stew
ingredients: [{'amount': '2', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': 'stew meat (bottom round roast or chuck roast), trimmed', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'uncooked lentils', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped carrots', 'notes': '300g'}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chopped yellow onion', 'notes': '120g'}, {'amount': '2.5', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'quartered baby golden potatoes', 'notes': '400g'}, {'amount': '178', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '\xa0frozen peas', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '14', 'unit': 'oz.', 'name': 'can fire roasted tomatoes', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '25', 'unit': 'oz.', 'name': 'beef broth', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': None, 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'smoked paprika', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'cumin', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': 'minced garlic', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'bay leaf', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'salt', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'black pepper', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/8', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': '\xa0cayenne pepper', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Trim beef by removing large areas of fat. Cut into 1 inch bite size pieces. Chop carrots, onions and potatoes.,Add all ingredients to the crockpot and cook on low for 8 hours.
title: Beef and Lentil Stew

description: This , is a dream come true on a busy night. An easy, high-protein recipe that tastes like a classic lasagna but requires no layering or baking. Loaded with protein, Italian flavors and simple ingredients, this delicious deconstructed lasagna is a weeknight favorite.
full_name: Lazy Lasagna Skillet with Ground Beef (No Raviolis)
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': 'lean ground beef ', 'notes': '96/4'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'white onion, chopped ', 'notes': '100g'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': 'minced garlic', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'salt', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'black pepper', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': 'Italian seasoning', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'dried basil', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'tomato basil pasta sauce ', 'notes': "32oz. (I like Rao's)"}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'beef broth ', 'notes': 'low sodium'}, {'amount': '8', 'unit': 'oz.', 'name': 'rigatoni noodles ', 'notes': 'measured uncooked'}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'oz.', 'name': 'low moisture part skim mozzarella cheese', 'notes': 'shredded'}, {'amount': '4', 'unit': 'oz.', 'name': 'part skim ricotta cheese', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'fresh chopped basil ', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'parmesan cheese', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'additional ricotta cheese', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Bring a pot of water to a boil for cooking the pasta according to the directions on the box.,While waiting on the water to boil, heat a large pan over medium heat and brown the ground beef while breaking into bite size pieces.,When the meat is almost completely cooked through, stir in the chopped onion, garlic, salt, pepper, Italian seasoning and dried basil. Cook until fragrant and the onions are beginning to soften, approximately 3-5 minutes.,Stir in the marinara sauce and beef broth and set to simmer while you cook the pasta noodles. Add the uncooked pasta to boiling water and boil according to the box instructions (about 13 minutes).,Once pasta is cooked, drain and add to the pan with the meat sauce. Let simmer for 2-3 minutes while mixing the noodles in well to fully combine.,Add the mozzarella and stir together until fully melted. While the lasagna is still hot add the ricotta cheese on top and slightly mix throughout the dish.,Top with freshly chopped basil, parmesan cheese and enjoy.
title: Lazy Lasagna

description: This , is another under 30 minute meal! These are my favorite especially during the hustle and bustle of the week! This dish is flavorful using simple ingredients and comes together before anyone can complain they’re hungry.
ingredients: [{'amount': '4', 'unit': None, 'name': '\xa0Style Andouille \u2063sausages', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '300', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'baby yellow potatoes halved \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'red bell pepper chopped', 'notes': '162g'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'yellow onion, chopped', 'notes': '144g'}, {'amount': '132', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'kale chopped \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '50', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'chicken broth (reduced sodium)\u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'minced garlic', 'notes': None}]
instructions: In a pot of boiling water boil potatoes for 5 mins. ⁣Alternativity you can microwave in a shallow dish of water until al dente not smashable.,Spray a pan with cooking spray. Once hot add 4 sausages and sear.,Add garlic, peppers and onions and sear for a few minutes until fragrant.,Stir and add chicken broth and potatoes.,Season with salt and pepper. Cover and cook for 7 mins, stirring occasionally. ⁣,Add chopped kale and stir until wilted. ⁣Enjoy!
title: Cajun Sausage and Potato Skillet

description: Taco Tuesday is a thing in our house and it’s a thing I love doing!! These, are a great way to switch it up from the usual taco and they’re fun to pile and eat!
ingredients: [{'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'La Banderita carb counter flour tortillas \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'olive oil \u2063spray', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt\u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'paprika\xa0', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'salt', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'onion powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'garlic powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': 'paprika', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'chili powder \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1.5', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'cumin', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': '\u2063fresh cracked pepper', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'lbs', 'name': 'ground beef', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Cooked tostadas', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Refried Beans', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Taco Meat', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Chopped Lettuce', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Chopped Red Onion', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Fresh Salsa', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'reduced fat Mexican cheese blend\u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'Greek nonfat yogurt', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': '\u2063finely diced radish \u2063', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Cover tortillas lightly in olive oil spray. Sprinkle with seasoning and bake at 355 for 5 mins each side. Then 2 mins each side. Then 1 min each side. Until crispy.,Brown your ground beef until cooked through. Mix seasonings in a bowl with water to form a slurry paste.,Add slurry paste to browned meat, mix and let simmer for 5 minutes while you prep your toppings.,Layer beans, taco meat, lettuce, onion, salsa, cheese, greek yogurt and radish.,Nutrition Facts for: 2 tostadas, ⁣120g refried beans, ⁣4 oz. taco meat, lettuce, red onion, 2 tbsp. salsa⁣, 14g reduced fat Mexican cheese blend⁣, 25g Greek nonfat yogurt , finely diced radish ⁣and hot sauce if desired
title: Beef and Bean Tostadas

description: This , is the most simple meal you’ll make all week. Toss all your ingredients into the crockpot in the morning and come home to juicy flavorful shredded chicken ready for sandwiches, wraps, burritos, pizza .. you get the point.
ingredients: [{'amount': '1.5', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': 'chicken breast ', 'notes': '(raw)'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'yellow onion, sliced', 'notes': '200g'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'full bottle G Hughs BBQ sauce (full bottle for extra sauce) see note', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'bagged coleslaw mix\u2063 (or shredded red cabbage, green cabbage and carrots)', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'thinly sliced red onion \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'juice of one lime \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'salt & pepper\u2063', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Line the crockpot with onions and top with raw chicken. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Top chicken with BBQ sauce.,Cover and cook on low for 4-6 hours or high for 3.,Once done cooking shred the chicken directly in the crockpot and mix together. Serve on buns with coleslaw.,Mix all coleslaw mix, onion, lime juice, salt and pepper together in a bowl and place in the fridge for at least an hour before serving. The lime will marinate the onions and leave a nice crispy tangy flavor to complement the meat. ⁣
title: Crockpot BBQ Pulled Chicken

description: These , are packed full of flavor complemented by the chili lime crema. Serve on pitas, lettuce wraps, tacos or just by itself!
full_name: Spicy Chicken Adobo Pitas with Chili Lime Crema
ingredients: [{'amount': '1.5', 'unit': 'lbs', 'name': 'chicken breast \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': '\xa0can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce (7oz)\u2063', 'notes': 'use half for less heat'}, {'amount': '7', 'unit': 'oz', 'name': 'water \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '220', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '(~1/2 container) salsa \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '15', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '\xa0light sour cream\u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'g', 'name': '\xa0lime juice', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'lime zest \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/4', 'unit': 'tsp', 'name': '\xa0chili powder \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': "Joseph's Bakery Pitas", 'notes': None}]
instructions: For the Chicken: Spray pan over medium heat with cooking spray. Salt and pepper chicken breast and sear. Once seared add chipotles, water and salsa. Stir and bring to a bubbling simmer over medium and cover. ⁣,Cook covered for 10 mins. Flip chicken. Cook covered for another 10 mins. Shred chicken with two forks and stir together. Chop peppers (I use my meat masher direct in the pan). Stir together. Simmer for a few minutes to allow the chicken to soak up the juices. ⁣,For the Crema: Mix everything together. Let set in fridge.,Warm pitas in the microwave for 10 seconds to soften. Add green leaf lettuce, 1 servings of chicken adobo mixture split between the two pitas. Top with crema and cilantro and enjoy
title: Chicken Adobo Pitas with Chili Lime Crema

description: This , is jam packed with flavor from simple ingredients. It’s also made in under 30 minutes!
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': 'chopped chicken breast', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'can', 'name': 'whole corn kernels \u2063', 'notes': 'drained'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'can', 'name': 'black beans, drained and rinsed \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': 'red bell pepper ', 'notes': 'chopped'}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'jar', 'name': 'salsa (30 tbsp) ** see note', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '3/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'basmati rice, uncooked \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '7', 'unit': 'oz.', 'name': 'water \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1.5', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': 'chili powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1.5', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': 'cumin\u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': '\xa0garlic powder \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': 'onion powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': 'salt', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'pepper', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'tbsp.', 'name': 'paprika \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': '* alternatively you can use taco seasoning of choice vs. seasonings listed \u2063', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Cut the chicken into strips, spray with cooking spray and season with chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, pepper and paprika. Mix together to coat chicken well. ⁣,Over medium heat spray cooking pan with cooking spray and sear chicken flipping often until almost cooked through. ⁣,Add beans, corn, salsa, water, bell pepper to the chicken and mix together.,Once mixed add the uncooked rice. Mix well. Cover and cook over medium to medium low for 10 mins stirring a few times to keep from burning the bottom.
title: Mexican Skillet

description: This , may seem simple but the taste is absolutely insane with flavor. Green chilies, tender chicken, white beans and simple spices are thrown into the crockpot, and simmered for hours. You'll come back to a hot, delicious comforting bowl of chili. Add your favorite chili toppings to really kick this bowl up a notch.
full_name: Slow Cooker Chicken and White Bean Chili
ingredients: [{'amount': '2', 'unit': 'lbs.', 'name': '\xa0chicken breast\u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'cans', 'name': 'white chili beans (rinsed and drained) \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'can', 'name': 'corn\u2063 (drained)', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'cans', 'name': 'chopped green chilies\u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'chicken broth \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': '\xa0cumin\u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': 'chili powder', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': 'onion powder \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/2', 'unit': 'Tbsp.', 'name': 'garlic powder \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'salt', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1', 'unit': 'tsp.', 'name': 'black pepper \u2063', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Put everything in the crock pot on low for 5 hours. Once done shred chicken in the crockpot and enjoy!! ⁣,Top with sour cream, cheese, avocado, red onion, or anything that sounds good! ⁣
title: Chicken and White Bean Chili

description: I could eat lavash pizza every single day. It is so easy, the macros are amazing and I love being able to create endless variations with toppings. This BBQ Chicken Pizza is one of my favorites.
ingredients: [{'amount': '1', 'unit': None, 'name': '\xa0full\xa0Josephs Lavash Bread', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'reduced fat cheddar cheese shreds', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '1/4', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'reduced fat mozzarella cheese shreds', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '3', 'unit': 'oz', 'name': 'Tyson blackened chicken strips, warmed and chopped \u2063', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '10', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'thinly sliced red onion', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '2', 'unit': 'tbsp', 'name': 'Bolthouse Farms Ranch Dressing', 'notes': None}, {'amount': '60', 'unit': 'g', 'name': 'G Hughes Sugar Free Honey BBQ\u2063 Sauce', 'notes': None}, {'amount': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'fresh cilantro \u2063', 'notes': None}]
instructions: Preheat oven to 350F. You can pre-crisp your lavash by putting in the oven at 350F on a baking sheet for 5 minutes.,Place lavash on a baking sheet and spread the BBQ on to coat evenly. Top with 1/2 of both cheeses, chicken and onion. Top with remaining cheese. This helps hold the toppings down.,Bake at 350F for 5 minutes until the cheese has melted. Broil at the end to get nice and crispy edges. Be careful not to burn.,Drizzle with ranch and top with fresh cilantro. Enjoy the entire pizza!
title: BBQ Chicken Pizza
